ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What type of roof does the house you live in have?
What type of roof does the house you live in have? Other (Specify)
What kind of toilet does your house have?
Notes: 1= No facility (e.g. bush, field, bucket); 2=Traditional pit latrine (mud, thatch); 3=Improved pit latrine (cement); 4=Flush toilet; 5=Other (Specify)

ElementDescription: What kind of toilet does your house have? Other (Specify)
What is the main flooring material in your house?
Notes: 1= Earth, dung; 2= Bricks; 3= Tiles; 4= Cement; 5= Wood/ Bamboo; 6=Other (Specify)

ElementDescription: What is the main flooring material in your house? Other (Specify)
Does your house have Eskom electricity, a generator, or solar panels?
How many days in a typical month are you without any form of electricity? A typical month is 30 days.
What is the main source of water for your household?
Notes: 1= Borehole; 2= Well; 3= River/Spring; 4= Community Kiosk; 5= Standpipe/Tap; 6= Other (Specify)

ElementDescription: What is the main source of water for your household? Other (Specify)
Does your household own a working bed with mattress?
Does your household own a working television?
Does your household own a working radio?
Does your household own a working land line or mobile phone?
Does your household own a working refrigerator?
Does your household own a working bicycle?
Does your household own a working motorcycle?
Does your household own a working animal drawn cart?
Does your household own a working car/ truck?
Does your household own a Bible or Koran?
